text:
By BBC Monitoring

British-Iranian dual national Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe's lawyer has expressed
hope that the Islamic Republic's judiciary will include her in the list of
those to be granted state pardon, ILNA news agency reported on 5 June.

"The Judiciary has recently issued instructions based on which those with
five-year sentences who have already served one-third of their terms will be
pardoned. I hope this will also apply to Ms Zaghari," Mahmoud Behzadirad told
ILNA.

On 23 May, news agencies reported that Ayatollah Khamenei has approved a
request from the Judiciary to pardon 3,721 prisoners, including a number of
those imprisoned for "security" reasons. Details of the pardon, such as the
names of political prisoners who might be on the list, have yet to be
published.

Behzadirad said while the court has extended Nazanin's leave, "nothing new has
been discussed with regards to her case and the situation remains unchanged".

"Fortunately, her leave has been extended and she is on leave wearing an ankle
tag; we will just have to wait and see what happens next," the lawyer added.

Nazanin has been on prison leave at her parents' Tehran residence since mid-
March. She was due to return to jail last week but she was informed by the
authorities that her temporary release had been extended until 27 May and
during this time a decision will be made on clemency.

Nazanin's husband, Richard Ratcliffe, said this week that she had called the
prosecutors' office on 30 May for an update, but "she was told again that
there is still no news, and to call back again next Saturday [6 June]".

Source: BBC Monitoring 5 Jun 20
